dspace-development.title: Import the September 2020 ETDs into DataSpace

comments.body: I have introduced some improvements into a gist for the documentation: https://gist.github.com/jrgriffiniii/d1e3deaf946caa0005d58023d2daf8d6

https://github.com/pulibrary/dspace-python/commit/290e3c57d6e7112e53d95f9e4b2a2314c246a9f1 introduces some of the needed updates, however I am still encountering the following error for some Proquest exports:

```
UnicodeDecodeError: 'utf-8' codec can't decode byte 0xe0 in position 416: invalid continuation byte
```

Related to #3300 — reworking this to only be about restoring files.
Closing this issue because preserved files do show the "reinstate" button — only items deleted before preservation don't show it.

pulfalight.title: Request Cart "toggle icon" is offset from "total items indicator" in Firefox
Ensure that the resource request form is accessible
Add test for request cart accessibility and fix violations
Integrate accessibility testing into the continuous integration workflow
Header should match newer PUL branding from Library homepage

comments.body: @kelynch and @tpendragon I would be happy to update LUX, and I'll make a ticket there unless @axamei has objections.

@kelynch One question: Why would we follow the main library website branding? The catalog branding is much closer to the PULFALIGHT look and feel, and it's much newer than the main website header. I'd be happy to change the bg color of the LUX header to black, but I'd rather not fuss with this too much unless it's a real priority.
fwiw the header color is also an open ticket for dpul https://github.com/pulibrary/pomegranate/issues/827

pulfalight.title: Suggest a correction icon needs alt text
Make "action link" appearance consistent
Cart has no 'x' to close when empty
Cart should close with escape
Clear request cart after submitting a request
"Search within collection" results need a H1-level page title/header
Dates should not display as a range starting from 0
Update normalized date indexing so that normalized titles contain correctly formatted dates
"Find Related Materials" facets don't return results.
Determine instructions for the integration of the Aeon request service with PULFALight

comments.body: Requests are implemented. Follow on tickets will get created as we find issues.

pulfalight.title: Observe and document the user behavior for Aeon requests

comments.body: Met with product owners. Once a request goes into Aeon, fulfillment staff never leave Aeon. They print a call slip which is used from that point forward to find the material. We think we've got this nailed down, just have to have the appropriate departments test the features when we have more data in.

pulfalight.title: ASpace does not export container locations to EAD

comments.body: We wrote https://github.com/pulibrary/princeton_ead_exporter to solve this problem.

pulfalight.title: Review the PULFALight Solr schema for field indexing

comments.body: Our entire indexing strategy is customized now, with our own tests. Closing this.

pulfalight.title: Implement collection-level notes, including filtering down to child components
Add Collection Notes & Tests for Them
Review the PULFALight Solr configuration for relevancy rankings

comments.body: @faithc @ccleeton @jrgriffiniii I'm reading this ticket as "Collections should show up before components in a search across all items." Is that true, even though collection-grouped search is the first result now? If not, can we close this? Blocking this pending feedback.

pulfalight.title: Search History via your account

comments.body:
It's kept forever (or until the user manually clears it). We can control anything. Is there an actionable thing we can do here to close this ticket?

@ccleeton @faithc Pinging you for feedback. Do we just remove the search history feature? Do we auto-clear it? Do we just need a note on the home page somewhere, if so where?

pulfalight.title: Review the prepopulated search results (default search results)

comments.body: @jrgriffiniii What are the "prepopulated search results"?

pulfalight.title: Provide access to institutional Princeton users (NetID-based authentication) to restricted digitized content

comments.body: Closed as duplicate (or rather going to be handled by) #389

pulfalight.title: Implements a new view for an expanded finding aid collection

comments.body:
https://github.com/pulibrary/pulfalight/pull/435/commits/59ff113557183ebde1fd87dda4717177b41a78d7 introduces the metadata for components with `scope note` and `arrangement`, as well as an `expand` and `collapse` button:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1443986/99620115-d5292500-29f2-11eb-9831-dfc7614f4eec.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1443986/99620077-bdea3780-29f2-11eb-9d04-fd409a1ba28c.png)

https://github.com/pulibrary/pulfalight/pull/435/commits/9f766d2b47b2841b75bd4157b001ade966ca4bda ensures that component titles are links and improves the styling for the extent badges:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1443986/99623428-18d35d00-29fa-11eb-8e6d-13fe24daea5d.png)
https://github.com/pulibrary/pulfalight/pull/435/commits/cbe210e9f31b57a09ca56e18c883eeb40534727f ensures that the Table of Contents component is collapsed for the expanded Collection View.

pulfalight.title: Should we have a facet for undated material?

comments.body: @ccleeton @faithc Can you answer this question? And if so, does it need to be there for the MVP?

I think we should have a facet for this, and yes, it would be preferable if it could be part of the MVP. Since numerous materials are undated, or do not have structured/normalized dates, they could be missed if a user is only able to select or only sees results with structured dates.

pulfalight.title: Keyword searches need to be supported within and across all collections

comments.body: This works.

pulfalight.title: Allow front page to load even if solr is down

comments.body: Solr's much more stable since we made this ticket, and it would be pretty difficult and be in direct confrontation with features like showing recently added items. Can we not? What do you think @hackartisan @jrgriffiniii ?

pulfalight.title: Relative PDF links in DAOs should not show a "View Content" button
<dao> elements with dead links should not be indexed into Solr fields

comments.body: Closed as duplicate of #490

pulfalight.title: Sylvia Beach Papers Collection Boxes are not indexed properly

comments.body: Indexing and source data are different, aspace containers are more reliable. Closing.

pulfalight.title: Add Topic Facet

comments.body: Renaming this "Add Topic Facet", since we already have subjects as a facet.

Not sure we want display the local topics as a facet (yet) as staff need to review these. The idea was to maintain them as a separate, browsable page for now, mimicking the current site. https://findingaids.princeton.edu/topics

@faithc I think that's https://github.com/pulibrary/pulfalight/issues/120. Should the "Topics" part in "find related materials" (https://pulfalight-staging.princeton.edu/catalog/aspace_C1491_c5078) still link to other items that have that local topic?
Oh yes, sorry, you're right. And yes, please!
We've determined this is just making the "Find related materials" Topics link work, rather than having a facet for topic. Thus, closing this as a duplicate of #509

pulfalight.title: Ensure that the intellectual description is displayed before the container information in the search results

comments.body: This is vastly different after wireframe work and implementation. The wireframe was agreed on, so I'm closing this.

pulfalight.title: Containers in the Toni Morrison Papers collection have invalid titles

comments.body: That's just what the title is, and it's displaying fine. Closing.

pulfalight.title: Typographical errors may exist for certain container and component titles

comments.body: Closing as container handling is different now with aspace. We can open another ticket if, once all our data is indexed, we find discovery concerns.

pulfalight.title: Filter by facets on a subset of collections

comments.body: This is really complicated and would require a new faceting search UI that implies "OR" instead of "AND," I think. What are the chances we can push this post-MVP @ccleeton @faithc?
I think this could be pushed to version 1.x. @ccleeton?

pulfalight.title: Make collection name in search results breadcrumbs be bold
Determine whether or not ReCAP items can be requested using Aeon

comments.body: @jrgriffiniii Is this actionable? I'm very confused.

pulfalight.title: Evaluate and ensure that Aeon Activity support is integrated with request functionality

comments.body: @ccleeton @faithc @sdellis This is marked as for MVP, but I don't see how to close this or work towards it even. Unless one of you have an idea of what this means for the user interface of Pulfalight, can we just close this?

@tpendragon I agree. The use case is to request an item for a class or event, correct? The only way I could see this working is if we had a static list of known Activities that PULFALight could present to the user when they are ready to submit the request. 

Would a static list serve Public Services' needs? What will Public Services do with the Activity information when they get it? Perhaps we could list examples that would make the need more clear?

pulfalight.title: Plain language for labels

comments.body: Closed by #508

pulfalight.title: Sidekiq requires CAS (single sign-on) authorization in order to access /sidekiq
Ensure that content negotiation exposes XML encoded finding aids

comments.body: @faithc @ccleeton @regineheberlein There's a full-sized HTML view of the content and staff are using ASpace. Also, there's no button for this in the wireframes. Do we need to provide the EAD data? It's not nearly as readily available when we're indexing out of aspace. If we do, can it be post-MVP?

I’ll let others chime in, but my feeling is that it’s a core functionality, especially because more and more researchers do data mining on our finding aids.

Regine Heberlein
Library IT Data Analyst
609-258-6156
heberlei@princeton.edu


From: Trey Pendragon <notifications@github.com>

Date: Thursday, November 19, 2020 at 5:16 PM
To: pulibrary/pulfalight <pulfalight@noreply.github.com>
Cc: "Regine I. Heberlein" <heberlei@princeton.edu>, Mention <mention@noreply.github.com>
Subject: Re: [pulibrary/pulfalight] Ensure that content negotiation exposes XML encoded finding aids (#107)


@faithc<https://github.com/faithc> @ccleeton<https://github.com/ccleeton> @regineheberlein<https://github.com/regineheberlein> There's a full-sized HTML view of the content and staff are using ASpace. Do we need to provide the EAD data? It's not nearly as readily available when we're indexing out of aspace. If we do, can it be post-MVP?

—
You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub<https://github.com/pulibrary/pulfalight/issues/107#issuecomment-730671216>, or unsubscribe<https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABNKKUZND4532W63PLULIRLSQWKLPANCNFSM4KNQUDKQ>.

+1 to the reason Regine mentioned. Staff also regularly refer to data here rather than accessing the record for quick reference. This behavior may change with the switchover to ASpace, but difficult to know now.
